item.title: Matthew add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Surprising what you can dig out of books if you read long enough, isn't it?" -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Take what you want, and pay for it." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Matthew add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "Such sweet compulsion doth in music lie." -- John Milton

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Humor is reason gone mad." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description:
"Room service? Send up a larger room."
[<i>A Night at the Opera</i>]" -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Age is not a particularly interesting subject. Anyone can get old. All you have to do is live long enough." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I don’t have a photograph, but you can have my footprints. They’re upstairs in my socks." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Either this man is dead or my watch has stopped." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Matthew add a quote by David Eddings
item.description: "What was that?" Belgarath asked, coming back around the corner. "Brill," Silk replied blandly, pulling his Murgo robe back on. "Again?" Belgarath demanded with exasperation. "What was he doing this time?" "Trying to fly, last time I saw him." Silk smirked. The old man looked puzzled. "He wasn't doing it very well," Silk added. Belgarath shrugged. "Maybe it'll come to him in time." "He doesn't really have all that much time." Silk glanced out over the edge. "From far below - terribly far below - there came a faint, muffled crash; then, after several seconds, another. "Does bouncing count?" Silk asked. Belgarath made a wry face. "Not really." "Then I'd say he didn't learn in time." Silk said blithely." -- David Eddings

item.title: Matthew add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "One word, Ma'am," he said, coming back from the fire; limping, because of the pain. "One word. All you've been saying is quite right, I shouldn't wonder. I'm a chap who always liked to know the worst and then put the best face I can on it. So I won't deny any of what you said. But there's one more thing to be said, even so. Suppose we have only dreamed, or made up, all those things-trees and grass and sun and moon and stars and Aslan himself. Suppose we have. Then all I can say is that, in that case, the made-up things seem a good deal more important than the real ones. Suppose this black pit of a kingdom of yours is the only world. Well, it strikes me as a pretty poor one. And that's a funny thing, when you come to think of it. We're just babies making up a game, if you're right. But four babies playing a game can make a play-world which licks your real world hollow. That's why I'm going to stand by the play world. I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia. So, thanking you kindly for our supper, if these two gentlemen and the young lady are ready, we're leaving your court at once and setting out in the dark to spend our lives looking for Overland. Not that our lives will be very long, I should think; but that's a small loss if the world's as dull a place as you say." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "If you love books enough, books will love you back." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "If I were omnipotent and omnibenevolent I wouldn't be so damn ineffable." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Charles Stross
item.description: "Gene police! You! Out of the pool, now!" -- Charles Stross

item.title: Matthew add a quote by David Weber
item.description: "Oh, bother!,” said Pooh, as Piglet came back from the dead." -- David Weber

item.title: Matthew add a quote by Thomas Frank
item.description: "Libertarianism is good because it helps conservatives pass off a patently probusiness political agenda as a noble bid for human freedom. Whatever we may think of libertarianism as a set of ideas, practically speaking, it is a doctrine that owes its visibility to the obvious charms it holds for the wealthy and the powerful. The reason we have so many well-funded libertarians in American these days is not because libertarianism suddenly acquired an enormous grassroots following, but because it appeals to those who are able to fund ideas. Like social Darwinism and Christian Science before it, libertarianism flatters the successful and rationalizes their core beliefs about the world. They warm to the libertarian idea that taxation is theft because they themselves don’t like to pay taxes. They fancy the libertarian notion that regulation is communist because they themselves find regulation intrusive and annoying. Libertarianism is a politics born to be subsidized. In the “free market of ideas,” it is a sure winner." -- Thomas Frank
